pullrequest.title: All pose messages are sent out in a single message every iteration

content.raw:
The unit magnitude (B, KB, MB) is based on totalBps. When I measure the bandwidth of /gazebo/default/physics/contacts in the firehose.world, I get the following:
~~~
Total[3.72 MB] Mean[0.00 MB] Min[0.00 MB] Max[0.01 MB] Messages[183]
Total[3.84 MB] Mean[0.00 MB] Min[0.00 MB] Max[0.01 MB] Messages[121]
Total[3.64 MB] Mean[0.00 MB] Min[0.00 MB] Max[0.01 MB] Messages[182]
~~~
There's a bunch of small packets in a short period of time, so the bandwidth is over 3 MBPS, while the messages are usually less than 0.01 MB. Perhaps we could use different unit prefixes for the bandwidth and message size?

The unit magnitude (B, KB, MB) is based on totalBps. When I measure the bandwidth of /gazebo/default/physics/contacts in the firehose.world, I get the following:

Total[3.72 MB] Mean[0.00 MB] Min[0.00 MB] Max[0.01 MB] Messages[183]
Total[3.84 MB] Mean[0.00 MB] Min[0.00 MB] Max[0.01 MB] Messages[121]
Total[3.64 MB] Mean[0.00 MB] Min[0.00 MB] Max[0.01 MB] Messages[182]

There's a bunch of small packets in a short period of time, so the bandwidth is over 3 MBPS, while the messages are usually less than 0.01 MB. Perhaps we could use different unit prefixes for the bandwidth and message size?
